clinical_study.brief_title: A Bioelectric Dressing for Post De-Roofing Treatment of HS
clinical_study.official_title: A Bioelectric Dressing for Post De-Roofing Treatment of Hidradenitis Suppurativa (HS)

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to test if the use of a bioelectric dressing can improve healing after a surgical procedure called de-roofing.

primary_outcome.description: The healing rate of post-surgical wounds will be reported as the area reduction in cm^2/per day.

secondary_outcome.description: The average time, measured in days, to complete healing as assessed by treating physician will be reported

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with complete healing
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects with complete post-surgical site healing, as evaluated by treating physician, will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with nodule and/or tunnel recurrence
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects with nodule and/or tunnel recurrence, as evaluated by treating physician, will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average pain as assessed by the Numerical Rating Scale (NRS)
secondary_outcome.description: The average pain will be measured using the NRS with scores ranging from 0-10 with the higher score indicating more severe pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with tenderness at surgical sites
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects with tenderness at surgical sites, as evaluated by treating physician, will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of post-surgical scars as measured by the Hurley Stage score
secondary_outcome.description: The Hurley score is staged as: 1 (single or multiple abscesses without sinus tract formation or scarring); 2 (recurrent abscesses with one or more sinus tracts and scarring widely separated by normal skin); 3 (diffuse involvement with multiple sinus tracts and no intervening normal skin)

secondary_outcome.measure: Amount of exudate at surgical site
secondary_outcome.description: The amount of exudate at surgical site will be evaluated using a 5 point Likert scale from 0 (Dry) to 4 (Leaking).
Shoulder range of motion will be measured using a goniometer

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of dressings used through to healing day
secondary_outcome.description: The number of dressings used through to healing day will be reported

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain after procedure as assessed by the NRS
secondary_outcome.description: The average pain will be measured using the NRS with scores ranging from 0-10 with the higher score indicating more severe pain.
Participants reported days of work lost due to the procedure will be reported

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of Life as measured by the DLQI
secondary_outcome.description: Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI) has a total score ranging from 0 to 30 with the lower score indicating higher health related quality of life
As measured by quantitative 16s rDNA Polymerase Chain Reaction for bacterial enumeration from punch biopsy and biofilm samples.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Bioelectric Dressing on the Right Armpit and Standard Gauze Dressing on the Left Armpit
arm_group.description: Participants undergoing standard of care deroofing surgery will be randomized to receive the bioelectric dressing for up to 8 weeks on the right armpit and will receive the standard gauze dressing for up to 8 weeks on the left armpit.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Bioelectric Dressing on the Left Armpit and Standard Gauze Dressing on the Right Armpit
arm_group.description: Participants undergoing standard of care deroofing surgery will be randomized to receive the bioelectric dressing for up to 8 weeks on the left armpit and will receive the standard gauze dressing for up to 8 weeks on the right armpit.

intervention.description: Procellera is single layer, broad-spectrum antimicrobial wound dressing. Embedded in the dressing are microcell batteries made of elemental silver and zinc applied in a dot-matrix pattern. The bioelectric dressing will be applied to surgical site wound with a hydrogel.
intervention.arm_group_label: Bioelectric Dressing on the Left Armpit and Standard Gauze Dressing on the Right Armpit
Bioelectric Dressing on the Right Armpit and Standard Gauze Dressing on the Left Armpit

intervention.description: Standard of care non-adherent gauze dressing will be applied to surgical site with vaseline.
intervention.arm_group_label: Bioelectric Dressing on the Left Armpit and Standard Gauze Dressing on the Right Armpit
Bioelectric Dressing on the Right Armpit and Standard Gauze Dressing on the Left Armpit

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults 18 years old and older.
- Have diagnosis of HS confirmed by a dermatologist
- Have at least two ancillary tunnels in separate anatomical sites
- Able to provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Individuals who are not yet adults
- Subject is allergic to any of the materials and dressings involved in the procedures
- Women known to be pregnant
- Prisoners
- Subjects, who in the opinion of the PI, cannot comply with hope application of the treatment
